definitions: a feeling of dissatisfaction or restlessness
context_programming: In the context of programming, it could refer to a developer feeling unhappy or unhappy with their current project or working environment
examples: The programmer was feeling discontent with her current project, feeling that it was not challenging or meaningful enough
The team was feeling discontent with the company's management, feeling that their concerns and ideas were not being heard or valued

conversations.statement: I'm starting to feel really discontent with this project. It's just not as interesting or rewarding as I thought it would be.
I understand how you feel. Maybe we can talk to the project manager and see if there are any ways to make it more fulfilling or challenging for you.

definitions: marked by turmoil, chaos, or disturbance
context_programming: In the context of programming, it could be used to describe a situation that is highly chaotic or tumultuous, such as a tumultuous software development project or a tumultuous team dynamic
examples: The software development project was tumultuous, with constant changes in requirements and tight deadlines causing stress and conflict within the team
The team dynamic was tumultuous, with frequent arguments and misunderstandings hindering progress and causing delays

conversations.statement: This project has been really tumultuous. I feel like we're constantly reacting to changes and problems rather than proactively planning and executing.
I know it's been tough, but we have to try to stay focused and find ways to address the turmoil and move forward.

definitions: to become calm or less agitated
context_programming: In the context of programming, it could be used to tell a team member or colleague to take a deep breath and approach a problem with a more level-headed approach
examples: The project manager had to tell the team to simmer down and focus on finding a solution to the bug, rather than getting frustrated and arguing with each other
The developer had to remind himself to simmer down and think logically when debugging the code, rather than getting overwhelmed and making mistakes

conversations.statement: Everyone, please simmer down and let's try to find a solution to this problem calmly and logically.
You're right, Alan. Let's all take a deep breath and approach this with a clear head.

definitions: to determine or establish a direction or plan of action
context_programming: In the context of programming, it could refer to setting the direction or goal of a project or determining the steps needed to achieve a certain outcome
examples: The project manager set course for the development team, outlining the necessary milestones and deadlines
The team set course for the new feature, breaking it down into smaller tasks and assigning them to individual team members

conversations.statement: We need to set course for this project and make sure everyone is on the same page. What are the main goals we're trying to achieve?
The main goal is to create a user-friendly interface and improve performance. We should also consider the potential for future expansion and scalability.

definitions: to be divided or separated by conflicting loyalties, interests, or feelings
context_programming: In the context of programming, it could refer to a developer feeling pulled in different directions by competing priorities or conflicting requirements for a project
examples: The programmer was torn between his desire to meet the project deadline and his need to maintain high quality code
The team was torn between using a new framework that promised faster development time and sticking with their tried and true methodologies

conversations.statement: I'm feeling really torn about this project. On one hand, I want to be innovative and try out the new framework, but on the other hand, I'm afraid it's not stable enough and could cause problems down the line.
I understand where you're coming from. It's always tough to balance the desire for progress with the need for stability. Maybe we can find a compromise or another solution.

definitions: means to kill someone, especially a public figure, for political or ideological reasons
context_programming: In the context of programming, it could refer to someone being targeted and attacked or sabotaged because of their programming skills or projects
examples: The young programmer was assassinated by a rival company who wanted to steal her innovative new software
The assassination of the lead developer caused chaos and disruption within the team.

conversations.statement: Did you hear about the programmer who was assassinated last week?
Yes, I heard about it. It's such a tragedy. He was a brilliant developer with so much potential.

definitions: means belonging to a high social class, especially the aristocracy
context_programming: In the context of programming, it may not necessarily be applicable, as social class does not usually have a direct impact on one's programming abilities. However, it could be used metaphorically to describe someone who is highly skilled or respected in the field of programming
examples: John is a true noble of the programming world, with years of experience and numerous successful projects under his belt
The nobles of the tech industry gathered at the annual conference to discuss the latest trends and innovations in programming.

conversations.statement: Have you heard of John Carmack? He's a legend in the programming world.
Yes, I've heard of him. He's a noble in the field, with so many groundbreaking contributions to the industry.

definitions: derogatory term that refers to ordinary people or the common people. It is often used to imply that someone is lower class or inferior.
context_programming: In the context of programming, it could be used to describe beginner programmers or those who are not highly skilled or experienced
examples: These plebs don't even know how to write a simple for loop!
I can't believe I have to work with these plebs on this project.

conversations.statement: I don't understand why we have to work with these plebs on this project. They have no idea what they're doing.
I know, it's frustrating. But we have to remember that everyone has to start somewhere. Let's try to be patient and help them learn.

title: Prejudice
description: prejudice refers to strong and unreasonable feelings which make you like some things but not others.

title: Impediment
description: Impediments are ANYTHING that prevent you from going as fast as possible.

title: Enforceable
description: (of a law or rule) possible to make people obey, or possible to make happen or be accepted
